intro: Cephalaria transcaucasica, commonly known as the Caucasian cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Transcaucasus region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Cephalaria transcaucasica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
